content:
• Tuesday, August 13, 2013
  • SALE

    RetailMeNot ratings roundup

    • RetailMeNot (SALE +1.5%) closed higher following its analyst initiations earlier today. The common theme of the 3 Buy ratings and 4 Neutral ratings? Enthusiasm about strong growth prospects tempered by concerns about a rosy valuation.
    • Stifel justifies its Buy rating and $38 PT by declaring "the scale and scarcity of the RetailMeNot platform make it a must-buy for national retailers, much like paid search and performance-based display advertising." The firm observes RetailMeNot's revenue from U.S. retail sites (78% of sales) is growing at a 25% rate.
    • RBC issued a Neutral rating and a PT of $33 on concerns RetailMeNot's dependence on search engines leaves it vulnerable to search algorithm changes that could "negatively impact RetailMeNot's ability to generate site traffic."
    • With shares up 56.1% since the company IPO'd last month, Credit Suisse went for a Neutral rating. Though It sees RetailMeNot as the likely winner in the fragmented online coupon space, valuation prevents it from assigning "a more constructive rating.”
     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 PM
  • INFO

    IHS slides after upping FY13 guidance, closing Polk acquisition

    • IHS (IHS -5.3%) fell after updating its FY13 (ends Nov. 30) guidance to reflect the closing of the $1.4B R.L. Polk acquisition. IHS is raising its revenue guidance to $1.8B-$1.82B ($1.66B-$1.73B previous) and EPS guidance to $4.75-$5.00/share ($4.23-$4.43 previous), but reducing its EBITDA outlook to $540M-$560M ($540M-$582M).
    • The research/consulting firm reiterates the Polk acquisition will be accretive to EPS by $0.40-$0.50 in 2014.
    • (PR), (CC)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:29 PM
  • CSCO

    BroadSoft closes higher on HIPCOM acquisition

    • Shares of BroadSoft (BSFT +5.9%) closed higher after the company announced the acquisition of Hosted IP Communications (HIPCOM), a U.K. communications-as-a-service provider, earlier today.
    • BroadSoft is aiming to expand the reach of its BroadCloud PBX service in the U.K. and continental Europe. The company stated the "majority of HIPCOM's employees will join BroadSoft."
    • The communications software developer expects the HIPCOM acquisition to contribute $500K to Q3 revenue and $1.6M to full-year revenue, and without diluting EPS.
    • Acquisitions have been a big part of BroadSoft's growth strategy. The company previously acquired Adaptation, a provider of VoIP solutions; Movial, a Finnish IP communications client developer; iLinc, a web collaboration services company; and Casabi, a startup that allowed traditional landlines to connect to the Internet.
    • Previous: BroadSoft beats Q2 estimates
     
     
     
     
    | 7:17 PM
  • RGSE

    More on Real Goods Solar's Q2

    • Real Goods Solar (RSOL +7.7%) is now down 10.9% AH after reporting Q2 revenue declined 3.3% Y/Y to $20.7M, even as installations rose 17.8% Y/Y to 5.6MW. RSOL attributed the results to "lower prices paid by customers as a result of competitive pricing pressures within the solar installation market."
    • Competition has put a squeeze on margins. Q2 gross margin was 23.1%, down from 24.8%, last year. 1H gross margin was 25% down from 29.6% last year.
    • The company managed to offset declining prices by paring opex 15.1% Y/Y to $7.9M, via productivity gains and cost controls.
    • Silver linings include 30% Y/Y growth in the residential business (including installations in Lennar homes), 46% Y/Y growth for RSOL's e-commerce site, and a $20M contract win from the Stockton Unified School District expected to commence in Q4.
    • Faced with a fragmented industry, RSOL is attempting to bulk up its top-line (as well as its balance sheet) via equity-based acquisitions such as its purchase of Mercury Solar last week and Syndicated Solar yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:00 PM
  • IMRS

    More on IMRIS earnings

    • IMRIS (NASDAQ:IMRS) Q2 EPS loss comes in line with expectations, while revenue beat slightly.
    • Revenue declined 40.6% year over year as bookings slipped, largely due to a sluggish environment for healthcare capital equipment.
    • The company says it continues to expect order variability from quarter to quarter.
    • Due to that variablility, it lowers guidance going forward, now projecting Q3 revenue of around $18M, trailing consensus forecasts by $1.79M.
    • FY13 revenue is seen around $50M, also lagging etimates by $15.68M.
    • Shares -4.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:37 PM
  • BRCD

    Brocade surges on FQ3 beat, strong guidance; SAN sales improve

    • In prepared remarks/slides, Brocade (NASDAQ:BRCD) guides for FQ4 revenue of $545M-$565M and EPS of $0.17-$0.19, largely above a consensus of $548.5M and $0.15. Free cash flow is expected to total $105M-$125M.
    • The company is fresh off adding a new CEO and sales chief.
    • Brocade's SAN revenue (storage switches/adapter cards, 69% of total revenue) only fell 2% Y/Y in FQ3, an improvement from FQ2's 6% drop. SAN revenue is expected to grow 1%-4% Q/Q in FQ4. End-market demand is said to be improving, but still softer than a year ago.
    • IP networking (Ethernet switches, routers) revenue fell 6% Y/Y, a reversal from FQ2's 15% growth (Brocade blames soft U.S. federal demand). But it's expected to grow 5%-12% Q/Q in FQ4, aided by sales of new Ethernet fabric switches. VDX switch sales rose 80% Y/Y.
    • FQ3 EPS was boosted by $100M in buybacks. $361M is left on Brocade's authorization. Also helping was a gross margin of 65.6% (+190 bps Y/Y and +50 bps Y/Y), and a 3% Y/Y drop in opex (job cuts). Gross margin is expected to fall slightly in FQ4 to 65%-65.5%.
    • Brocade's top 3 OEM partners (EMC, IBM, H-P) accounted for 47% of revenue. 61% of revenue was domestic (64% in FQ2).
    • BRCD +15.8% AH to new 52-week highs. FQ3 results, PR.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:23 PM

  • After-hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: BRCD +15%. CUZ +3%. BEAT +2%. SOXS +2%. CSU +2%.
    • Top losers: XONE -13%. SEAS -13%. MM -8%. MCOX -6%. NTI -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • SEAS

    More on SeaWorld earnings

    • SeaWorld (NYSE:SEAS) Q2 misses on all counts. Net earnings swung to a loss amid expenses related to its IPO in April, early debt-extinguishment losses and other items.
    • Top line results were hurt by lower attendance as the result of new pricing strategies as well as impacts from an earlier Easter holiday season and adverse weather conditions at some of its parks.
    • The company lowers its revenue outlook for 2013, now expecting to earn between $1.45B to $1.48B, versus its previous estimate of $1.46B to $1.49B.
    • Shares -11.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM
  • FN

    Fabrinet jumps and fades on Q2 results

    • Fabrinet (FN +2.9%) was up as much as 15% earlier in the day following its FQ4 beat, before fading in afternoon trading.
    • FQ4 revenue of $159.9M was up 12% Y/Y. Full year revenue of $564.7M was up 13.6% from 2012.
    • The company's FQ1 guidance of $158M-$162M is in-line with a consensus $159.3M. EPS of $0.31-$0.33 parallels a consensus of $0.32.
    • CEO David Mitchell stated on the CC investments in new business opportunities that began nearly two years ago are starting to yield "real revenue contributors," as Fabrinet goes into FY14.
    • Other contract manufacturers also rallied: FLEX +1.8%, CLS +1.9%.
    • (PR), (CC transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM
  • MXC

    Mexco Energy shares soar on deal for Wolfcamp acreage

    • Mexco Energy (NYSEMKT:MXC) +33.9% AH on news it received ~$626K in cash from Pioneer Natural Resources (NYSE:PXD) for the assignment of a three-year term leasehold interest in 417.33 net acres (837.33 gross acres) at $1,500/acre in the horizontal Wolfcamp trend of the Permian basin in west Texas.
    • MXC also announces participation as a working interest co-owner with EOG Resources (NYSE:EOG) in drilling three Wolfcamp horizontal wells.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • MM

    Millennial Media buying rival for $197M, guidance fails to impress

    • In tandem with its Q2 report, Millennial Media (NYSE:MM) announces it's buying rival mobile display ad network Jumptap for 24.6M shares (worth $196.8M based on Millennial's AH trading price of $8). JumpTap shareholders will own 22.5% of the company post-acquisition.
    • Millennial and Jumptap (occasionally feared as a rival and once planning an IPO) are apparently betting their combined forces will yield a tougher rival to Google's AdMob (the market's unquestioned leader) and Apple's iAd. Following disappointing guidance earlier this year, fears have been running high that Millennial is losing share.
    • Those fears might not be soothed by Millennial's Q2 revenue miss, nor by its new guidance: Millennial projects the two companies will have combined 2013 revenue of $340M-$350M. Millennial had previously forecast 2013 revenue of $270M-$280M (up from 2012's $178M thanks to rapid industry growth), and Jumptap posted 2012 revenue of $63.6M.
    • The companies are expected to have combined 2013 adjusted EBITDA of -$1M to $1M. Millennial previously expected 2013 adjusted EBITDA of $17M-$18M.
    • Jumptap brings 100M user profiles (44M multi-screen) and a big patent portfolio (55 issued, 50 pending) to the table. Millennial had 450M monthly unique users at the end of Q2 (up 30M Q/Q) and supported 45K apps (up 3K Q/Q). $20M-$25M in deal synergies are expected.
    • Millennial's Q2 opex rose 51% Y/Y, higher than rev. growth of 45%.
    • MM -5.9% AH. Q2 results, PR, Jumptap slides
     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • BIOF

    BioFuel Energy -18% AH on Q2 results

    • BioFuel Energy (NASDAQ:BIOF) reports a Q2 net loss of $4.7M vs. a $12.4M net loss in the year-ago period, and revenues of $91M fell ~30% Y/Y.
    • Says it has received indications of interest in its two ethanol plants but no offers it considers meaningful; it also is evaluating the possibility of obtaining other sources of financing that would enable retention of one or both plants.
    • Shares -18.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • PLAB

    Photronics EPS in-line, beats on revenues

    • Photronics (NASDAQ:PLAB): FQ3 EPS of $0.10 in-line.
    • Revenue of $109.7M (-6% Y/Y) beats by $1.09M. Shares -1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • XONE

    ExOne falls on Q2 miss, light 2013 guidance; peers lower

    • ExOne (NASDAQ:XONE) now expects 2013 revenue to be "at the lower end" of a prior guidance range of $48M-$52M (consensus is at $50.5M). The company says it doesn't expect any more laser drilling machine sales this year, and that a weak yen and year-end shipment timings will also affect results.
    • Fellow 3D printer makers are lower in sympathy: DDD -2.7% AH. SSYS -0.9%. The group has been on a tear lately.
    • ExOne's 2013 gross margin is now expected to be at the end high end of a prior guidance range of 42%-46%. Q2 GM was 45.3%, +950 bps Q/Q and +1270 bps Y/Y.
    • Machine sales rose nearly 4x Y/Y in Q2 to to $5.8M, but products, materials, and other sales rose by only $200K to $3.4M. Four high-end S-Max 3D printers were sold (one each to Japan, India, Russia, and the U.S.) vs. two in Q1.
    • No S-Print, M-Lab, or Orion systems were sold (one of each was sold in Q1).
    • Opex +12% Y/Y to $5.2M. R&D rose over 3x Y/Y, but still only totaled $1.3M.
    • XONE -15.4% AH. CC at 8:30AM ET tomorrow.
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM | 5 Comments
  • MYGN

    More on Myriad Genetics earnings; guides FY13 above estimates

    • Myriad Genetics (NASDAQ:MYGN) sees 2014 EPS between $1.87 - $1.94 and total revenue of $690M to $710M, above analyst estimates of EPS at $1.86 and revenue of $665.8M.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • NTI

    Northern Tier Energy in 11.5M-share offering, shares -4.8% AH

    • Northern Tier Energy (NYSE:NTI) announces a public offering of 11.5M shares of common stock representing limited partner interests; the partnership will receive no proceeds from the sale.
    • Shares -4.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 10 Comments
  • MYGN

    More on Myriad Genetics earnings

    • Myriad Genetics (NASDAQ:MYGN) FQ4 beats across the board.
    • Total revenue rose 31% Y/Y, Net income +51%.
    • Molecular diagnostic testing revenue +30%, Oncology +19%; Women's Health +51%; BRACAnalysis test revenue +19% (represented 74% of total revenue in Q4); BART(NYSE:TM) test revenue +310% (represented 11% of total revenue); companion diagnostic service revenue +47%.
    • Operating margins were 37.9%, compared to 35.6% in the prior year period, primarily due to operating leverage realized from efficiencies in SG&A and R&D expenses.
    • Shares +2.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • BIOS

    BioScrip announces public offering, shares slip

    • BioScrip (NASDAQ:BIOS) announces a 6.8M share public offering by selling stockholders. Morgan Stanley is the sole bookrunner. (PR)
    • Shares -5.43% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • SEAS

    SeaWorld misses by $0.10, misses on revenues

    • SeaWorld (NYSE:SEAS): Q2 EPS of $0.41 misses by $0.10.
    • Revenue of $411.3M (-3% Y/Y) misses by $23.2M. Shares -11.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • CREE

    Cree issues soft FQ1 guidance, lighting margin slumps

    • CREE expects FQ1 revenue of $380M-$400M and EPS of $0.36-$0.41, mostly below a consensus of $398.4M and $0.43.
    • FQ4 gross margin was 38.2% (-60 bps Q/Q, +190 bps Y/Y), below guidance of 39.5%. An FQ1 gross margin of 39% is expected.
    • While LED products (components) had a 45.7% gross margin (+190 bps Q/Q), lighting products only had a 25.1% GM (-550 bps Q/Q). Cree recently introduced relatively cheap consumer LED bulbs.
    • LED products 58% of revenue vs. 56% in FQ4. Lighting products 36% vs. 37%, power/RF 6% (unchanged).
    • Opex +12% Y/Y, less than rev. growth of 22%. SG&A +18% to $61.7M as LED lighting sales/marketing efforts ramp.
    • CREE now -14.5% AH. CC at 5PM ET.
    • FQ4 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 3 Comments
  • MM

    Millennial Media beats by $0.03, misses on revenues

    • Millennial Media (NYSE:MM): Q2 EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $57M (+45% Y/Y) misses by $2.24M. Shares -9.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARTX

    Arotech closes with a solid gain after beating Q2 estimates; raising guidance

    • Shares in Arotech (ARTX +26%) hold firm to yesterday's post-session gains after reporting a solid Q2 and increasing its full-year guidance late Monday.
    • The stock traded up more than 38% at one point, setting a 52-week high of $2.71 before settling back.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • BRCD

    Brocade soars after earnings

    • Brocade (NASDAQ:BRCD): FQ3 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $536.6M (-3% Y/Y) beats by $17.76M. Shares +17.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • VIAV

    JDS Uniphase EPS in-line, misses on revenues

    • JDS Uniphase (JDSU): FQ4 EPS of $0.13 in-line.
    • Revenue of $421.3M misses by $9.34M. Shares -2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • PMT

    PennyMac Mortgage launches secondary offering

    • PennyMac Mortgage Investment Trust (NYSE:PMT) announces a 11.3M share secondary with greenshoe option of 1.695M. If the greenshoe is exercised, it would add 22% to the float.
    • Shares -2.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 2 Comments
  • XONE

    ExOne misses by $0.03, misses on revenues

    • ExOne (NASDAQ:XONE): Q2 EPS of -$0.08 misses by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $9.2M (+97% Y/Y) misses by $0.13M. Shares -15.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 3 Comments
  • CREE

    Cree falls hard after earnings

    • Cree (NASDAQ:CREE): FQ4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $375M (+22% Y/Y) misses by $2.21M. Shares -9.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • CLD

    Coal stocks take a breather after recent run-up

    • Coal stocks (NYSEARCA:KOL) head south after a recent run of gains, as natural gas prices turn lower: CLD -4.2%, BTU -3.1%, ACI -1.1%, CNX -0.7%, ANR -0.6%.
    • J.P. Morgan’s John Bridges notes the strong link between coal stocks and the price of natural gas because coal competes with gas for marginal sales; a high gas price means more sales for more affordable coal power.
    • At the same time, Bridges thinks the better coal names may become interesting for patient investors if China's economy indeed has stabilized; the difficulties in valuing ANR and ACI keep him Neutral, but he remains positive on CNX as a special situation in coal.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 5 Comments
  • FBP

    First Bancorp off as Treasury sells stake, but may be a good value

    • Puerto Rico's First Bancorp (FBP -3.7%) prices a 28M share secondary - with Treasury unloading 12M shares, Thomas Lee 8M, and Oaktree 8M. The sale leaves Treasury with about a 10% stake, and the combined stakes of Lee and Oaktree at about 20%.
    • The stock's now off about 23% in less than a month, but Sandler O'Neill spots value, upgrading to Buy. Assuming the DTA ($523.4M or $2.53 per share) is recaptured, the $8.50 price target is a modest premium to book value.
    • Further, Sandler believes "an inflection point with respect to credit" has been hit which should allow the bank to get back to normal operations.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • VSCP

    VirtualScopics soars on solid Q2 earnings beat

    • VirtualScopics (VSCP +30.9%) is set to close markedly higher today, after its Q2 swung to a profit versus a year ago.
    • Sales rose to $3,706,677 from a year ago's $3,335,861.
    • Net income was $134,286, up from a loss of $62,966 a year earlier.
    • YTD 2013 new project awards totaled $15.9M as compared to $4.6M during the same period in 2012, a 246% increase.
    • Gross margin rose to 48% compared to 40% the year earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • WTSL

    Wet Seal is much improved but difficult retail environment weighs: Dougherty

    • Tell us something we don't know: Dougherty says "a lack of trend in teen retail coupled with weak results from competitors" will likely cap any upside in shares of Wet Seal (WTSL -2.9%).
    • This comes despite the fact that the company's fortunes have "dramatically improved after returning to its fast fashion roots under CEO John Goodman."
    • WTSL shares are initiated at Neutral.
    • Well-documented retail woes: ARO, AEO.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • IAG

    IAMGOLD shares higher despite reporting Q2 loss

    • IAMGOLD (IAG +2.2%) shares are higher despite reporting a Q2 earnings loss, as results were hurt by lower gold prices and impairment charges.
    • With 55% of its cost reduction target achieved and on track to reaching $100M by end of 2013, IAG lowers 2013 guidance for total cash costs for all gold mines to $790-$840/oz. from $850-$925/oz. and all-in sustaining costs to $1,150-$1,250/oz. from $1,200-$1,300/oz.
    • The Westwood mine is on pace to hit commercial production in October and should result in 130K-150K oz. for the year; IAG maintains company-wide guidance of 875K-950K oz. (earnings call)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • FCX

    Freeport McMoRan says Indonesia export ban may cut copper output

    • Freeport McMoRan (FCX -2.1%) warns that Indonesia's rules on mineral processing and ban on ore exports after 2014 may impact production at its Grasberg mine, the world's second-biggest copper mine.
    • FCX signs two memorandums of understanding with Indonesian companies planning to build smelters to process the ore, both also plan to use concentrate from the Indonesian unit of Newmont Mining (NEM -2.4%).
    • FCX says it currently processes only ~40% of its ore domestically, but the prevailing law requires it to smelt all of the ore within Indonesia from January 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 6 Comments
  • BRLI

    BioReference makes acquisition, establishes West Coast presence

    • BioReference Laboratories (BRLI +2%) acquires most of Hunter Laboratories' assets, giving BRLI a West Cost presence and Medi-Cal in-network status.
    • "Having a local base for operations can provide significant operational and logistical synergies," CEO Marc Grodman notes. (PR)
    • Shares of Neogenomics (NEO -7.8%), a notable peer, are off sharply on the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • NEPT

    Neptune Technologies initiated with a Buy at H.C. Wainwright; shares higher

    • Neptune Technologies (NEPT +6.7%) gets a boost from an initiation with a Buy ratings at H.C. Wainwright today and news that its subsidiary, Acasti Pharma (NASDAQ:ACST), had reported positive results from Phase II trials of CaPre.
    • The firm notes that NEPT offers a singular 2-in-1 long option for investors who want to maintain a presence in the omega-3 market by covering both OTC marine supplements and prescription pharmaceuticals.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • IEP

    Disclosure of Apple stake boosts Icahn Enterprises

    • Icahn Enterprises (IEP +1.7%) pops after Carl Icahn discloses a position in Apple.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • NUAN

    Nuance spikes on Icahn's Apple disclosure

    • Nuance (NUAN +2.3%) has spiked higher after Carl Icahn announced on Twitter he now has "a large position" in Apple.
    • Icahn has gradually raised his stake in Nuance to 16% from the 9.3% originally disclosed in April, and there could be speculation Icahn will push Apple (not historically prone to making big acquisitions) to buy part or all of Nuance, whose voice-recognition tech helps power Siri.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • EXC

    Exelon's ComEd prices $350M bond sale at 4.6%

    • Exelon's (EXC -1.2%) Commonwealth Edison prices $350M of its First Mortgage Bonds maturing in August 2043, with a 4.60% coupon.
    • ComEd plans to use the proceeds to repay a portion of its outstanding commercial paper obligations as well as other corporate purposes.
    • Mitsubishi UFJ, Morgan Stanley and UBS led the offering as joint book-running managers.
    • The sale closes on Aug. 19.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • CYS

    Buy ratings removed for CYS Investments and Javelin Mortgage

    • Maxim Group pulls its Buy ratings from CYS Investments (CYS -2.3%) and Javelin Mortgage (JMI -3.4%) after big declines for both.
    • CYS - an owner strictly of agency-backed MBS - is off 32% YTD with forward dividend yield (if maintained) of 17%. The company one month ago reported a 20% dip in book value in Q2 to $10.20 as of June 30. Today's share price of $7.99 is a 21.7% discount to that figure.
    • Javelin - which owns non-agency paper as well - is also off 32% YTD with forward dividend yield (if maintained) of 21.3%. The company last week reported a 17.8% Q2 decline in book value to $15.12 as of June 30. The current price is a 14.2% discount to that figure.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • ALIM

    Alimera plunges after Q2 results

    • Alimera Sciences (ALIM -15.3%) plummets after reporting Q2 results.
    • Revenue for the period was $179K (18 Iluvien units sold), while R&D expenses rose 16% Y/Y to $2.2M as ALIM incurred $240K in contracting costs.
    • General and administrative expenses rose 60% on "professional fees associated with the establishment of infrastructure and tax planning for expansion in Europe."
    • Sales and marketing expenses jumped 345% Y/Y and will likely rise further as the European launch of Iluvien moves forward.
    • Cash and equivalents stood at $31.9M as of June 30. (PR)
    • Conference call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • AAPL

    Icahn discloses Apple position, calls for bigger buyback; shares jump

    • Carl Icahn on Twitter: "We currently have a large position in APPLE. We believe the company to be extremely undervalued. Spoke to Tim Cook today."
    • More from Icahn: "Discussed my opinion that a larger buyback should be done now. We plan to speak again shortly."
    • Apple (AAPL +4.1%) shares have jumped on the disclosure. The company added $50B to its buyback authorization in April.
    • Update: Statement from Apple: "We appreciate the interest and investment of all our shareholders. Tim [Cook] had a very positive conversation with Mr. Icahn today."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 40 Comments
  • CPN

    Calpine fires up power plant operations in California

    • Calpine (CPN -1.8%) launches commercial operations at its Russell City Energy Center and Los Esteros Critical Energy Facility, both located in the San Francisco Bay area.
    • Combined, the two plants bring on-line more than 900 megawatts of combined-cycle natural gas-fired power generation capacity, capable of meeting the electric needs for around 750K households.
    • The full power output of both plants will be delivered to Pacific Gas and Electric (PCG -1%) under 10-year power purchase agreements.
    • CPN owns 75% of the project, while GE (GE -0.3%) unit GE Energy Financial Services owns the balance.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • MON

    Monsanto drop overdone, Goldman says in maintaining Conviction Buy

    • Monsanto (MON +1.6%) is maintained as a Conviction Buy with a $122 price target by Goldman Sachs, which sees the recent share price decline as overdone given MON's historical precedent for strong earnings growth even following declining corn prices.
    • Fades in corn prices are common, but so too are subsequent strong MON corn earnings results, the firm writes; the only decline in corn profits in the past decade for MON came in 2010, which Goldman attributes more to product launch issues with SmartStax than corn price declines.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • LKM

    NQ Mobile blasts off on Q2 beat, guidance hike

    • NQ Mobile (NQ +21.7%) shares are up 216% YTD, and 172% just since late June, after the Chinese mobile software vendor soundly beat Q2 estimates, raised its 2013 guidance, and reported very strong registered account/MAU growth.
    • Topeka has raised its PT all the way to $33.50 from a prior $25. Canaccord's PT has been raised to $28 from $17. SA contributors Treasure Hunter and Steven Weitz have been fervently bullish for some time.
    • On the CC, co-CEO Omar Khan mentioned NetQin's premium user base (not counting paid security accounts) had grown from "tens of thousands" at the end of Q1 to "millions" at the end of Q2.
